content.description: It starts with 10 feet of easy slab up to a chossy seam where the first two bolts are placed. After passing the choss, it gets solid and you have to decide which great holds you want to haul on, till you get to a bulge at a seam just below the anchors. Pulling the bulge is the usual Iowa hunt for hands and feet, followed by clipping the anchors.  Except for the second bulge this is a stiff 10.
content.location: To the right of C N red is a shorter wall with a crack through the middle. This climb is the farthest right on that wall.
Currently the only route left of the arch on Mother Wall

content.description: Start left of Doin the Smurf.  Ascend the mossy slab and get to the good rock.  Some nice pulling on smaller somewhat hidden holds leads to good jugs and then a crux at the top, traverse to the right to the shared anchors with Smurf.
The climb has two cruxes. The first is the start which is bouldery. The second is a crimpy sequence at the third bolt.
content.location: The route is at Motherwall, which is to the right of a prominant arch on the other side of the river about 200 yards up river from Boulevard wall. It has a vein of sandstone running through the limestone.

content.description:
Mother Wall has the tallest climbs at Indian Bluffs. 

  More descriptive information is needed.  Please suggest if you care to contribute.
